Weapons supply (N) is important but less immediately impactful than building military capacities and securing intelligence. Options such as starting peace negotiations (F) or trade agreements (D) are lower priorities in urgent crisis management. Cyber and surveillance options (I, J, O) can provide intel advantages but may not be as effective as tangible military support. Invasive or nuclear options (P, Q, R, S) are drastic measures that would lead to severe escalation, making them the least reasonable choices.
